FuncDef:
The ssh authentication-type default password command configures password authentication as the default authentication mode for users who request to log in to a device using SSH.
The undo ssh authentication-type default password command cancels the configuration. The ssh authentication-type default password command configures password authentication as the default authentication mode for users who request to log in to a device using SSH. The undo ssh authentication-type default password command cancels the configuration. By default, password authentication is used.
ExtraInfo: When users request to log in to a device using SSH, if no SSH user is created using the ssh user, ssh user authentication-type, and ssh user service-type commands, successful user login depends on whether the ssh authentication-type default password command is run.
